title: Dungeons & Dragons Rolltables
description: A compendium of 5e compatible rolltables generated by ChatGPT.

campaignEntries.rawText:
## Melee
| d20 Roll | Mishap |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | Your weapon slips from your hand and flies 15 ft. in a random direction. Anyone in the weapon's path must make a Dexterity saving throw or take damage as if hit by the weapon. |
| 2 | You overextend and drop your guard, granting advantage on the next attack against you in this round. |
| 3 | Your attack ricochets back at you. Make another attack roll against your own Armor Class. If it hits, you take your normal damage. |
| 4 | You lose your balance, knocking yourself prone. |
| 5 | Your melee weapon is lodged into the ground or nearby environment, requiring a Strength check to free it. |
| 6 | Your attack goes wide and hits an ally within 5 ft. Make a new attack roll against their Armor Class. |
| 7 | You overexert yourself in the attack, suffering 1 level of exhaustion. |
| 8 | Your attack results in hitting yourself. Roll for damage as if you were hit by your own attack. |
| 9 | Your weapon breaks on impact, rendering it useless until repaired. |
| 10 | You suffer a minor injury, reducing your speed by 10 feet until you receive healing or complete a short or long rest. |
| 11 | You whirl around uncontrollably after your miss, facing away from your opponent and becoming disoriented until the end of the next turn. |
| 12 | You are so focused on the attack that you fail to notice a hazard in your environment. The DM chooses an appropriate hazard. |
| 13 | You miscalculate your strike and it hits a wall, causing a shower of debris. Any creature within a 5-foot radius, including you, must make a Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of your next turn. |
| 14 | Your weapon cord (if any) wraps around your hand, making your weapon effectively stuck to your hand until you spend an action to untangle it. |
| 15 | You overexert your swing and pull a muscle. You suffer disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws until you complete a short or long rest. |
| 16 | Your miss exposes a weak point in your defense. The next attack against you before the beginning of your next turn has advantage. |
| 17 | You stumble and fall prone after the missed attack. Your movement speed is reduced by half until the end of your next turn. |
| 18 | Your opponent may make one opportunity attack against you as a reaction. |
| 19 | Your failed attack leaves you wide open, your opponent can immediately make a free melee attack against you. |
| 20 | You sprain your wrist, causing any future attacks to impose disadvantage until you receive healing. |

## Ranged
| **d20 roll** | **Ranged Attack Critical Failure Effect** |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | Your weapon slips from your hand as you make your attack, landing 10 feet in the direction of your target.|
| 2 | Your bowstring snaps, making your weapon useless until repaired. |
| 3 | A miscalculated release sends your projectile high in the air, the miss completely obvious and potentially warning enemies of your location. |
| 4 | A ricochet sends your projectile flying back at you. Make a Dexterity saving throw or take damage as if you hit yourself. |
| 5 | The wind picks up just as you release your attack, causing it to veer wildly off course. |
| 6 | Your projectile snags on your clothing as you release it, sending it wildly off course and dealing damage as if you hit yourself. |
| 7 | A string, wire, or other essential part of your ranged weapon breaks during the attack. The weapon is unusable until repaired. |
| 8 | You misjudge the weight of your weapon or projectile, causing your attack to fall short and reveal your position. |
| 9 | You drop your ammunition while drawing your weapon. You must use an action to pick it up. |
| 10 | A sudden cramp in your arm or shaking in your hand causes your aim to veer widely off the mark. |
| 11 | Your weapon jams or your bowstring snags, squandering the attack. |
| 12 | You strain a muscle during the attack. Until you take a short rest, you make attack rolls with disadvantage. |
| 13 | The distraction of an aiming misfire causes you to lose focus on your surroundings, giving enemies a chance to sneak up unnoticed. |
| 14 | Your weapon breaks from the force of your attack. It is unusable until repaired. |
| 15 | You accidentally aim too low and shoot the ground in front of you, causing ricochet stones or debris. Take 1d6 bludgeoning damage. |
| 16 | Your projectile veers off and hits an unintended target, potentially a teammate or innocent bystander. |
| 17 | You trip over your own feet and fall prone in your current location. |
| 18 | The force of your attack leads to a wild swing, moving you 5 feet in the opposite direction. |
| 19 | Your grip slips at the crucial moment, sending the weapon itself flying from your hand and landing 10 feet in the direction of your target. |
| 20 | A string, wire, or other essential part of your weapon breaks, dealing 1d6 slashing damage to you. |

## Arcane
| Roll (d20) | Mishap |
| --- | --- |
| 1 | The attacking spell rebounds in unpredictable ways and you suffer the full effect of your own spell. |
| 2 | You become temporarily blinded by the flash of a misfired spell. You are blinded until the end of your next turn. |
| 3 | A portal to a random plane is momentarily opened in front of you. A small, harmless extraplanar creature appears and is disoriented. |
| 4 | Your spell and all other light sources within 30ft of you are suddenly extinguished, plunging the area into darkness. |
| 5 | There is an explosion of arcane energy, everyone (including yourself) within a 10ft radius takes 1d4 force damage. |
| 6 | You unintentionally amplify your spell outputs. You and all creatures within 20ft of you become Deafened until the end of your next turn. |
| 7 | All of your hair stands on end due to the static of a foul magic and remains so until removed of the condition. |
| 8 | A loud, thunderous boom accompanies your spell, causing all creatures within 100ft to become aware of your location. |
| 9 | The arcane energy of your spell causes a vibration harm to yourself. You gain one level of Exhaustion. |
| 10 | You seem to become a magnet for magic. For the next hour, all spell attacks against creatures other than you have disadvantage, but spell attacks against you have advantage. |
| 11 | Your spell is unexpectedly converted into a shower of harmless flower petals, the area within 10ft of you is mildly obscured. |
| 12 | Arcane feedback causes you to forget the spell you just cast. You can't cast it again until after you complete a long rest. |
| 13 | Your spell targets randomly select one creature within range. If there are no other creatures, it selects you. |
| 14 | A puff of smoke rises from your hands, your hands are magically dyed a bright color for a day. |
| 15 | Your voice amplifies unnaturally, anything you say for the next minute can be heard up to 300ft away. |
| 16 | An arcane shockwave is released, and all creatures within 10ft of you are pushed 5ft away from you. |
| 17 | You lose your sense of direction for 1d4 rounds, drastically affecting your navigation skills. |
| 18 | You overchannel your spell. The burnout renders you unable to cast any more spells until after a short rest. |
| 19 | Your spell misfires and attacks an object within range, chosen by the GM. |
| 20 | A random magic effect occurs, according to the spell mishap table determined by your GM. |

## Melee
| Roll (1d20) | Boon |
|-------------|------|
| 1 | Your attack leaves the enemy stunned, giving you advantage on your next attack against them. |
| 2 | Your weapon rends a piece of gear on your opponent, impairing their defense. Reduce their AC by 1. |
| 3 | You exploit a gap in the enemy's stance. Your attack reduces their speed by half until their next turn. |
| 4 | Your attack knocks the enemy off-balance. Your next attack against them has advantage. |
| 5 | You aim your attack to disable. The enemy has disadvantage on their next attack roll. |
| 6 | Your attack leaves a deep wound. The enemy takes 1d4 bleed damage at the start of their next turn. |
| 7 | You disarm your opponent. Their weapon flies 10 feet in a random direction. |
| 8 | Your strike is so powerful it pushes your enemy 5 feet backwards. They must succeed on a Strength saving throw or lay prone. |
| 9 | The force of your blow makes your enemy drop something they're holding (GM's choice). |
| 10 | Your attack inspires your allies. They gain a +1 morale bonus on their next attack roll. |
| 11 | Your attack weakens your enemy. They have disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws until their next turn. |
| 12 | Your strike is blinding fast, the enemy is unable to react to your next attack. |
| 13 | Your attack unbalances your enemy, giving them disadvantage on their next Dexterity saving throw. |
| 14 | Your thunderous attack can be heard by all nearby creatures, potentially scaring off weaker ones. |
| 15 | Your attack shorts out any magic item your opponent was wielding or wearing for one turn. |
| 16 | The confidence from your attack bolsters up your next saving throw giving you advantage. |
| 17 | Your attack severs your enemy's supply pouch, causing them to lose one of their healing potions or similar item. |
| 18 | Your attack detonates any explosive or high volatile item your enemy has in their possession. |
| 19 | Your attack scares the enemy, giving them disadvantage on attacks against you for the rest of the combat. |
| 20 | Your attack breaks your enemy's morale, forcing them to make a Wisdom saving throw or flee. |

## Ranged
| d20 Roll | Boon |
|---|---|
| 1 | Your arrow finds a gap in the enemy's armour, causing an additional die of damage. |
| 2 | An incredible shot ruptures the enemy's weapon, disarming them. |
| 3 | Your projectile ricochets off a surface, hitting a second target. |
| 4 | The force of your shot pushes your target 5 ft back. |
| 5 | Your arrow integrates a vital organ, causing the target to be stunned on their next turn. |
| 6 | Your shots terrify the enemy. They must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of your next turn. |
| 7 | The velocity of your shot breaks through an environmental obstacle, opening new paths or cover. |
| 8 | Your shot distracts the enemy, leaving them unable to use reactions until their next turn. |
| 9 | Through an impressive display of skill, you fire two shots at once. Roll another attack against a secondary target. |
| 10 | Your critical hit causes the target to bleed. They take additional damage at the start of each turn equal to your Dexterity Modifier. |
| 11 | Your shot knocks the wind out of the enemy, halving their speed until they use a full action to recover. |
| 12 | The ambient forces enhance the momentum of your arrow, causing the attack to deal force damage instead. |
| 13 | Your shot reveals a weak point in your enemy's defence. The next attack on them from an ally has advantage. |
| 14 | Your shot pins the enemy to a nearby surface, they are restrained until they successfully make a Strength check to free themselves. |
| 15 | Your sheer mastery with the weapon allows the next attack on the same turn to have a bonus equal to your proficiency bonus. |
| 16 | The enemy's equipment is shattered by your projectile, handicapping them in their next action. |
| 17 | Your shot strikes true, ignoring any damage resistance the target may have. |
| 18 | Your amazing aim allows for a homing shot. Your next ranged attack automatically hits the same target unless line of sight is completely broken. |
| 19 | Your shot lifts enemy's feet off the ground, toppling them. The target is knocked prone. |
| 20 | A true display of mastery. Roll damage for the attack twice, adding both results together. |

## Arcane
| d20 Roll | Boon Description |
| -------- | ---------------- |
| 1    | Your arcane attack becomes especially potent. The target takes an additional 2d10 arcane damage.|
| 2    | Your control over arcane forces strengthens. Gain advantage on spell attack rolls until the end of your next turn.|
| 3    | An arcane beacon pulses from the target struck, reducing its resistance to all damage types until the end of your next round.|
| 4    | Arcane energy overflows from your successful attack. All foes within 10 feet of your target take 2d6 magic damage.|
| 5    | An arc of energy leaps from your target to hit another, dealing half the original damage to the secondary target.|
| 6    | The arcane energy used in your attack rejuvenates you, restoring 1d8 hit points.|
| 7    | Your hit resonates with arcane power, staggering the target. It loses its next action.|
| 8    | Your arcane attack holds residual energy. You gain +1 to your AC until the end of your next turn.|
| 9    | You tap into the very essence of magic itself. For your next spell cast, you don't spend a spell slot.|
| 10   | Your arcane attack creates a shield around you, providing half-cover until your next turn.|
| 11   | An echo of your arcane attack bounces back to buff you, increasing your spell save DC by 1 for the next round.|
| 12   | Your magical attack unbalances the surrounding mana. All magic users in a 10ft radius of the target have disadvantage on their next spell attack roll.|
| 13   | Pure arcane energy manifests as a duplicate of your spell, landing another attack on your original target.|
| 14   | Your arcane prowess intimidates nearby enemies. Foes within sight must make a Wisdom saving throw or be frightened of you until the end of their next turn.|
| 15   | Your accurate arcane attack siphons some of the target's vitality, healing you for a quarter of the damage inflicted.|
| 16   | Your arcane attack creates a burst of force throwing your target back 10 feet.|
| 17   | The sheer power of your arcane attack leaves the target dazed, giving it disadvantage on its next attack roll.|
| 18   | Your arcane attack radiates an aura of dread around the target. Enemies within 5 feet of the target must make a Wisdom save or be frightened until the end of their next turn.|
| 19   | The critical power of your attack unlocks a chain of magic within you granting an extra spell slot of the highest level you can cast.|
| 20   | The ultimate boon: Your arcane attack shifts reality itself. Instantly restore all expended spell slots.|

## Aarakocra
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Xara | A veteran warrior with feathered wings the color of steel, solemn and disciplined. |
| 2 | Tultac | A legendary sage and historian with light grey feathers, known for his vast knowledge and serene demeanor. |
| 3 | Quara | A scout with swift wings and an eye for detail, living up to her role with serious commitment. |
| 4 | Jrakk | An elder with pure white feathers, revered for her wisdom and thoughtfulness. |
| 5 | Ounrae | A healer with gentle blue plumage, her calm composure inspires trust in those she mends. |
| 6 | Raam | A black feathered trader, always serious and unyielding when it comes to dealings. |
| 7 | Corvus | An aarakocra fighter with feathers as black as night, as serious as they come. |
| 8 | Stryx | Skilled hunter with rust-colored feathers, known for precise strikes and silent maneuvers. |
| 9 | Wolara | An orange-feathered diplomat, known for her calm demeanour during tense negotiations. |
| 10 | Zephyra | Albino ritualist known for a stoic personality and precise chanting during religious ceremonies. |
| 11 | Yarak | A dark green sentinel standing tall, focused solely on the protection of his people. |
| 12 | Skerra | Sky-blue messenger, capable of swift and precise deliveries, maintaining a focused demeanor. |
| 13 | Kriv | Bronze-feathered artisan, meticulous in his craft and strict in maintaining quality. |
| 14 | Lorara | An elder sage with silver feathers, her seriousness and wisdom unfathomable. |
| 15 | Nemon | Brown-feathered courier, his dedication to timely and safe delivery unwavering. |
| 16 | Ura | A white-feathered priestess, solemn and entirely devoted to her spiritual duties. |
| 17 | Kesarak | A quiet and stern teacher with navy blue plumage, dedicated in imparting knowledge. |
| 18 | Vokk | A serious and efficient cook, his bright red feathers as fiery as his determination. |
| 19 | Omarr | The solemn guardian of the forest with dark green feathers, committed to its protection. |
| 20 | Pyrra | A patient and methodical cartographer with violet feathers, recognised for her precise workmanship. |

## Aasimar
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 1 | Sarathiel | A stoic warrior with silver hair and violet eyes. She has two feathered wings that shimmer with an ethereal light. Always armored and ready for battle. |
| 2 | Tamriel | An elder sage with wisdom beyond his age. He has radiant topaz eyes and shiny, metallic golden hair. His wings are large, white, and always seems to gently flutter. |
| 3 | Caladrius | A healer with a serene presence. He has long, curly blond hair and sapphire eyes that glimmer with kindness. His wings are an iridescent white. |
| 4 | Eleutheria | A serene maiden with a warhammer. Green-eyed with cascading waves of chestnut hair, she has two large, feathered wings that shine brightly, regardless of the ambient light. |
| 5 | Eosphoros | A scholar of arcane knowledge with long silver hair and eyes that sparkle like stars. His wings radiate a feeling of tranquility. |
| 6 | Seraphina | A young Aasimar with gold-flecked teal eyes and long, flowing white hair. Her wings emit a soft light and she has a tranquil aura. |
| 7 | Zophiel | A guardian with vibrant red hair and golden eyes. His strong wings carry an aura of authority. Always vigilant. |
| 8 | Ophiel | A bald, muscular Aasimar with piercing blue eyes. His wings are a radiant silver, and he carries with him an aura of peace. |
| 9 | Xaphan | A silver-haired Aasimar with eyes that glow like embers. His wings are a smoky grey, and he wields a flaming sword. |
| 10 | Eloa | A fair maid with golden locks and eyes that radiate with an inner light. Her wings are comparable to the evening sun – warm and welcoming. |
| 11 | Nathaniel | A strong yet somber soldier with dark green eyes and hair like black obsidian. His wings mirror his demeanor – serious and watchful. |
| 12 | Simiel | An agile scout with eyes the color of clear skies and dashing white hair. His wings move silently as the morning breeze at dawn. |
| 13 | Eremiel | A slender, silver-eyed figure with golden strands for hair. His wings shimmer with celestial luminosity. |
| 14 | Merisiel | A broad-shouldered Aasimar with sable hair and melancholy aquamarine eyes. His wings are grand, their aura somber. |
| 15 | Jophiel | A soldier with fiery eyes and crisp, white hair. His wings flutter intensely, radiating a fierce sense of duty. |
| 16 | Penemue | An Aasimar with chestnut hair and focused brown eyes. Her wings are an iridescent white. She is committed to preserving and sharing wisdom. |
| 17 | Remiel | Features softened by age, Remiel possesses lavender eyes and long silver hair. His wings radiate a soothing light. |
| 18 | Sahaqiel | A figure with shadows in his sapphire eyes and ivory hair streaked with silver. His wings carry the chill of a moonlit night. |
| 19 | Suriel | A seer with pearl white hair and keen emerald eyes. His wings seem to shimmer with the colors of the auroras. |
| 20 | Zerachiel | A warrior with sturdy silver wings, icy blue eyes, and hair as white as snow. Her presence is calming, despite her warrior's mien. |

## Bugbear
| Dice Value | Name                | Description                                                                                                        |
|------------|---------------------|--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| 1          | Grarrk the Silent   | Grarrk is an unusually soft-spoken and stealthy bugbear. He prefers to keep to himself and avoids conflict when he can. |
| 2          | Krukk Blood-Claws   | Krukk is a grizzled, scar-covered bugbear with mean, blood-red eyes. He's known for his brutal fighting style.                     |
| 3          | Rorthoc the Sturdy  | Burly and reliable, Rorthoc stands out among the bugbears for his undying loyalty towards his tribe.                                  |
| 4          | Zagg the Quick      | Zagg is freakishly fast for a bugbear, giving him an edge in both hunting and battle.                                                      |
| 5          | Yvgor the Wise      | Yvgor is an elder bugbear shaman known for his vast knowledge and arcane powers.                                                          |
| 6          | Thokk Broken-Tooth  | Formerly a fearsome warrior, Thokk now serves as a cautionary tale about the hazards of hubris, due to an injury that never healed properly.                  |
| 7          | Gurrn Three-Scars   | Gurrn is a ruthless bugbear chieftain that rules over his tribe with an iron fist.                                                         |
| 8          | Nok Bonecrusher     | Known for his strength, Nok is a rightly feared bugbear that crushes foes without mercy.                                                   |
| 9          | Ulgabrust the Grim  | Ulgabrust is a seasoned warrior, hardened by many battles and skirmishes. His presence is intimidating to even the bravest.               |
| 10         | Grothok the Fierce  | Grothok is a fierce and combative bugbear, known for his reckless bravery and true warrior spirit.                                        |
| 11         | Zarug the Feared    | Zarug has a dangerous reputation for his cunning and ruthlessness, making him a feared name among the enemies of bugbears.              |
| 12         | Hurknog One-Eye     | Hurknog is a grizzled veteran missing an eye, a loss that appears to have done nothing to dampen his fighting spirit.                    |
| 13         | Bragol Bone-Breaker | Bragol is a terrifying bugbear executioner known for his sadistic laughter. He serves the chieftain as enforcer and torturer.                                      |
| 14         | Skith Night-Prowler | Skith is a shadowy figure, an expert scout and spy. He spends most of his time skulking in the dark.                                      |
| 15         | Mong the Slaughterer| Mong's reputation as a bloodthirsty killer precedes him. Few opponents live long enough to regret underestimating him.                   |
| 16         | Urgnar the Vicious  | Urgnar is mean and vile, even by bugbear standards. Cross him at your own peril.                                                           |
| 17         | Wrukk the Ruthless  | Wrukk is a cruel and merciless bugbear who terrorizes his opponents with brute force and terror.                                         |
| 18         | Yargol the Daemon   | Yargol is a bugbear said to be possessed by a hellish spirit. His actions and appearance are terrifying to behold.                        |
| 19         | Grash the Phantom   | Grash is an outcast bugbear who lives in the wilderness. His existence is the stuff of ghost stories among his kin.                      |
| 20         | Hrothgar the Mad    | Terrifying and unpredictable, Hrothgar's sanity is questionable. He's known to howl at the moon and fights with startling ferocity.      |

## Changeling
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|------------|------|-------------|
| 1 | Eldin | A solemn looking changeling whose eyes hold an unending well of sadness. Eldin tends to keep their shapeshifting to a minimum, generally appearing as a gaunt and grey-skinned individual. |
| 2 | Syl | This changeling maintains a facade of a short, pragmatic halfling woman, Syl's true form only comes into play during dire situations. |
| 3 | Renn | Preferring the guise of a sophisticated elf with an air of nobility, Renn is a changeling known for their charm and intelligence. |
| 4 | Verin | Mostly assumes the form of a robust human blacksmith, but the telltale white hair slips through sometimes, leaving Verin's real identity a secret to few. |
| 5 | Nysa | Nysa uses her shapeshifting abilities to present herself as a young gnomish girl, enabling her to infiltrate and gather information unnoticed. |
| 6 | Dontan | Always seen in the guise of a grizzled dwarf warrior. Dontan rarely reveals his changeling form, taking pride in the persona he maintains. |
| 7 | Rael | Rael is a changeling that has taken the form of a wise old man, preferring to live out his days in peace rather than partaking in covert actions. |
| 8 | Elara | Prefers to appear as an ethereal half-elf with silver hair. Elara is a changeling who thrives on deception and plays many roles seamlessly. |
| 9 | Irys | Often seen in the form of a beautiful maiden. Irys is a changeling who uses her powers of transformation to gather information and manipulate others. |
| 10 | Drystan | The robust figure of a half-orc is Drystan's preferred form. Not keen on subtlety, he uses his talents to initiate brute force or intimidation when required. |
| 11 | Orys | Orys very rarely shifts form, preferring to stick to his neutral and ambiguous changeling look, which helps him blend in with various races. |
| 12 | Belis | Preferring the form of a bookish gnome, Belis is a changeling with a passion for knowledge and arcane lore. |
| 13 | Yara | Often seen in the deceptive guise of a beggar or a harmless old lady, Yara uses her shape-shifting skills to their utmost for various purposes. |
| 14 | Soren | Soren prefers the powerful image of a dragonborn warrior to mask his changeling nature, playing upon fear and respect in equal measure. |
| 15 | Faelen | A talented bard who frequently changes between various forms to entertain his audience, Faelen prefers to live his life in the spotlight. |
| 16 | Eirene | Always seen in the guise of a mysterious, aloof high-elf. Eirene has mastered the art of blending in while gathering obscure details. |
| 17 | Valen | Valen has chosen the form of a stoic, battle-scarred human mercenary, allowing him to walk freely among both commoners and soldiers. |
| 18 | Morwen | Preferring to appear as a charming noblewoman, Morwen navigates high society as easily as she does her own changeling nature. |
| 19 | Toren | A changeling who typically assumes the appearance of an intimidating teifling rogue, Toren finds power and freedom in fear and obscurity. |
| 20 | Zephyr | Takes the form of a wild and mischievous fey creature, but Zephyr's ethereal and faintly glowing form gives away his changeling nature. |

## Dragon
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Sarthastrasz | A venerable red dragon, known for his brutal tactics and a deep sense of honor. His scales bear the scarification of countless battles. |
| 2 | Tiastramagk | A hypnotic green dragon, her cunning and manipulation are to be feared as much as her poisonous breath. |
| 3 | Berinath | An ancient silver dragon, as sage as he is just. Known to help mortals in their time of need. |
| 4 | Cindaryx | A young brass dragon, his keen curiosity often leads to unpredictable outcomes. His scales shimmer in the desert sun. |
| 5 | Yastildix | An imposing black dragon, residing in the swamp lands, feared for her cruelty and corrosive acidic breath. |
| 6 | Feryndastrasz | A bronze dragon of noble lineage, guarding the coasts with diligence and valor. |
| 7 | Hryskarix | An elusive white dragon known for his icy breath and solitary nature. Prefers cold, desolate lands for his dwelling. |
| 8 | Quiverscale | A copper dragon whose boundless love for riddles and pranks has caused trouble on numerous instances. |
| 9 | Yarjhan | A gargantuan red dragon, his tyrannical reign has kept many kingdoms in fear for centuries. |
| 10 | Pernastrasz | An elder gold dragon known for his wisdom, charisma and magic abilities. Regarded as a deity by a few mortal civilizations. |
| 11 | Xethrinda | A keen-eyed blue dragon with a dangerous sense of cunning. Her lightning breath is the least of willful intruders’ worries. |
| 12 | Athalsar | An gold dragon, known for his diplomacy and ability to broker peace between warring factions. |
| 13 | Ythian | A black dragon, whose residence in the murky depths has steeped him in an aura of dread and decay. |
| 14 | Kuranaz | A blue dragon, his fierce intellect and knowledge of arcana make him a formidable opponent. |
| 15 | Thaurumbras | A bronze dragon, his affinity for the sea and tempestuous nature make him unpredictable yet indispensable in naval warfare. |
| 16 | Ulkair | A green dragon, notorious for his love for manipulation and expectation of absolute obedience from subordinates. |
| 17 | Glaysa | A silver dragon, she is known for her healing abilities and benevolence. Her majestic presence beckons hope and tranquility. |
| 18 | Dralliosastra | A white dragon, feared for her icy breath and her skill in camouflage against snowy terrains. |
| 19 | Vyralsathrax | A copper dragon, his love for storytelling is matched only by his constant search for treasure and relics. |
| 20 | Zurigath | An ancient brass dragon known for his omniscience and vast repository of lore spanning millennia. |

## Dragonborn
| Dice Value | Name | Description |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Draal | Draal is a stoic, heavily-scarred Dragonborn warrior. His bronze scales have faded with age. Known for his unwavering loyalty and commitment to justice. |
| 2 | Nazgrix | A sapphire-scaled dragonborn sorcerer who speaks in a calm yet commanding voice. Holds a deep reverence for ancient dragon lore and magic. |
| 3 | Thava | Tall and statuesque, Thava is a silver-scaled Dragonborn cleric. She holds a strong sense of responsibility towards the well-being of her people. |
| 4 | Khorvash  | Brass-scaled Khorvash is a renowned, level-headed Dragonborn chieftain, respected for his strategic mind and wartime leadership. |
| 5 | Kongir  | Kongir, a scholarly Dragonborn with faded green scales, is often found pouring over books, in search of old wisdom and forgotten tales. |
| 6 | Morgath | Onyx-scaled Morgath, a silent and stoic Dragonborn ranger, knows every crag and crevice in his mountain home like the back of his claw. |
| 7 | Erazix  | Erazix the black is a Dragonborn rogue with a dubious reputation. Not one for conversation, his profound skills are often shrouded in mystery. |
| 8 | Tharagar | Gold-scaled Tharagar is a broad-shouldered Dragonborn warrior. Known for his brute strength and unwavering commitment to his clan. |
| 9 | Yevelda | Yevelda, a silver dragonborn, stands out for her unusual curiosity about realms beyond her homeland and her passion for change. |
| 10 | Vervoth | Vervoth, a gold Dragonborn paladin, projects an aura of quiet authority. His steadfast faith and firm belief in order has earned him many followers. |
| 11 | Gheshanna | A leader in her own right, Gheshanna bears emerald dragonborn scales and carries a soft, understanding voice that commands respect. |
| 12 | Salrox | Salrox the Copper, while unassuming at first glance, is a Dragonborn bard whose tales of legendary heroes can inspire even the most disheartened of hearts. |
| 13 | Arjhan | Bearing burnished bronze scales, Arjhan the Dragonborn monk follows a path of discipline and self-improvement, striving to achieve perfect harmony. |
| 14 | Zofia | Zofia, a white Dragonborn druid, has an innate connection with nature that surpasses that of most, her stories from the wild hold many in rapture. |
| 15 | Shruikan | Shruikan, a red dragonborn, is often misunderstood due to his introverted nature, but his arcane knowledge is second to none. |
| 16 | Vargach | Vargach, a stoic, scarlet Dragonborn, is a blacksmith by trade. His precision and dedication to his craft is legendary in his hometown. |
